intro: Oreodaphne subalpina, commonly known as the Alpine Daphne, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves, which emit a distinctive fragrance. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it adapts to cool and moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
